medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Anisomastia became evident around the time developmental delay was recognized, approximately after the first year of life. Surgical repair was performed at age 15, and anisomastia persisted despite surgery.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Mild to moderate developmental delay; history of dental hypoplasia, enlarged left atrium, hoarse voice from vocal cord nodules, umbilical hernia (surgically repaired at age 5), gastroesophageal reflux (medically treated), attention deficit disorder (medicated), recurrent urinary tract infections, and severe hyperopia requiring bifocal lenses.
medical_history.family_history: The father died of liver cirrhosis due to chronic alcoholism; otherwise, both parents and a sister were reported to be healthy.
